content.question: A sample of <math alttext="N 2 O 4 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is placed into an evacuated container at <math alttext="373 kelvin" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>373</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and allowed to undergo the reversible reaction <math alttext="N 2 O 4 gas is in equilibrium with 2 N O 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>â‡„</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. The concentration of each species is measured over time, and the data are used to make the graph shown above. Which of the following identifies when equilibrium is first reached and provides a correct explanation?

choices.label: At 14 seconds, because <math alttext="the molar concentration of N 2 O 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is twice <math alttext="the molar concentration of N O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, which implies that the forward and reverse reaction rates are equal.

At 23 seconds, because <math alttext="the molar concentration of N O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> equals <math alttext="the molar concentration of N 2 O 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, which shows that equal concentrations are present at equilibrium.

At 40 seconds, because <math alttext="the molar concentration of N O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is twice <math alttext="the molar concentration of N 2 O 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, which matches the stoichiometry of the balanced chemical equation.

At 60 seconds, because <math alttext="the molar concentration of N O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the molar concentration of N 2 O 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> remain constant, indicating that the forward and reverse reaction rates are equal.

content.answer: At 60 seconds, because <math alttext="the molar concentration of N O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="the molar concentration of N 2 O 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> remain constant, indicating that the forward and reverse reaction rates are equal.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
